name: European Elevator Association
goal:
EEA represents lifts, escalators and components companies towards the European Commission, the European Parliament and other related bodies
when required for its objectives, which include:
- to participate in the formulation of standards and regulations;
- to participate in all dialogues with any public or private institutions relating to elevators, freight lifts, escalators, moving walkways, manufacturing of their components or associated systems;
- to define minimum qualification standards and adopt certification procedures;
- to promote information for, and continuing training of, set-up or maintenance personnel;
- to follow up regulatory developments at national, Community or international level that affect or may affect the interests of the members of the Grouping;
- to follow up national implementation of European measures;
- to handle, research and answer individual requests of members;
- to organize conferences, seminars, workshops and study days on topics falling within the scope of its purpose;
- to draft, publish and sell publications, brochures, studies and periodicals on topics falling within the scope of its purpose.
interests: Business and Industry, Competition, Consumers, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market
euInitiatives: All initiatives, policies and legislative files which may impact the lift, escalator, moving walk and lifting platform sector, such as for instance Directives 2014/33/EU, 2006/42/EC, 2009/125/EC, 2010/30/EU, 2010/31/EU, 2012/27/EU
